column2: Do you think that there\xc2\x92s a town in Missouri or some place called\nSample? And ah, as you\xc2\x92re driving into town there\xc2\x92s-there\xc2\x92s like a sign,\nand it says \xc2\x93You\xc2\x92re in Sample.\xc2\x94 (He says it like urine sample.)'
(entering) Hey.'
Hey! '
How\xc2\x92d it go with Pete?!'
Tell us!'
You\xc2\x92re not gonna believe this. Okay, so I go over...'
I\xc2\x92m sorry. Ex-excuse us. I\xc2\x92m sorry, it\xc2\x92s a little\ncrowded. Do you mind if we... (motions to the couch)'
Yeah, could you scooch?'
Yeah, move over just a little bit. '
Keep on scooching.'
So guys, listen, I go over there, and umm...'
Why? Why?! What\xc2\x92s wrong with me?!'
What\xc2\x92s the matter?'
I have a feelin\xc2\x92... I, my wife is sleeping with her gynaecologist.'
How do you know?'
Well y'know, he\xc2\x92s got access."
Yeah.'
Y'know it\xc2\x92s that feeling you get, y'know?"
Like when you go bowling and you know you\xc2\x92re in somebody else\xc2\x92s\nshoes?'
That\xc2\x92s the one.'
All right, so, so you went to Pete\xc2\x92s...'
What happened?'
(Robin is speaking loudly again) I...'
Why is this happening to me?! I don\xc2\x92t know, maybe it\xc2\x92s my\nwound.'
Forget it. (they all turn and listen to Billy and Robin)'
So it\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s not heeled yet?'
No-no, it\xc2\x92s ooozing, oozing. (to Rachel) Could you pass me the\ncream? Is there any\xc2\x97Oh, there\xc2\x92s the cream.'
Thomas, this is gonna be hard, but I wanted it to come from me, and\nnobody else.'
What is it, Tim?'
It\xc2\x92s me, I\xc2\x92ve been sleeping with your wife.'
(to Billy) So you\xc2\x92re the gynaecologist?'
(to Joey) Hey, I\xc2\x92m trying to have a private conversation! Is that\nokay?!'

(starting to cry) Ooh, (to Rachel) Can I have a napkin, please? Could you
please hand me a napkin? (Rachel tries to grab one, but is to slow for his tastes.) Would
you--Give me this thing (grabs the napkin holder from her.) all right!! Enough! (to Billy)
And you are no longer my friend! We are finished! (gets up to leave) Nada!! No more! You
are a bastard for doing this!! (Billy follows him) Get away from me!!'
Thomas, come back here! (they both leave)'
So Monica, what were you gonna tell us?'
(pause) I have no idea.'
So, come on, what was the big news Pete wanted to tell you Mon?! Or\nshould I say Mrs. Monica Becker?'
No-no-no oh, keep your name, don\xc2\x92t take his name.'
He didn\xc2\x92t ask me to marry him.'
Ohh.'
Well then definately don\xc2\x92t take his name.'
He wanted to tell me he\xc2\x92s gonna compete is some ultimate fighting\ncompetition thingy.'
Pete?!'
Why?! What is it?'
I don\xc2\x92t know exactly. It\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s sorta like wrestling.'
(intrigued) Oh?!'
Yeah, but without the costumes.'
(disappointed) Oh.'
And it\xc2\x92s not fake, it\xc2\x92s totally brutal.'
Yeah, it\xc2\x92s two guys in a ring, and the rules are
So you can like, bite, and pull people\xc2\x92s hair and stuff?'
Yeah, anything goes, except ah, eye gouging and fish hooking.'
What\xc2\x92s fish hooking?'

Huh, what\xc2\x92s fish hooking... (Joey sticks his finger in Ross\xc2\x92s\nmouth and pulls on his cheek, y'know like when you hook a fish.) (to Joey, sarcastic)\nThanks man, that would have been really hard to describe. What is that taste?"
What? My hands are totally clean, I just gave the duck a bath.'

So thanks for the warm welcome. It\xc2\x92s good to have you guys on my\nteam, and I come to play. I hope you do too. Now, let\xc2\x92s go out there and get\n\xc2\x91em! Huh? And remember, there is no \xc2\x91I\xc2\x92 in team.'
Yes, but there\xc2\x92s two in martini, soo everybody back to my\noffice.'
(to Chandler) You! Chuckles! What\xc2\x92s your name?'
Oh it\xc2\x92s Bing, sir. I\xc2\x92m sorry , I was just ah...'

No-no, I heard what you said, funny. I like funny. (Chandler starts to\nleave) This team is about hard work, but it\xc2\x92s also about having fun. Good to have you\naboard Bing! (smacks him on the butt, and Chandler leaves shocked.)'
(on phone) That\xc2\x92s right, Ryder. Wynona Ryder for six. (listens) Thank\nyou. (hangs up) (to the gang) Yeah, we have the reservations.'
Yes!!'
All right buddy, way to go! (smacks him on the butt)'
(stunned) Dude, what are you doing?'
Thank you! Today, my boss keep slapping my butt and he was acting like\nit was no big deal.'
Yeesh, what\xc2\x92d you do about it?'
Well, I didn\xc2\x92t do anything. I didn\xc2\x92t want to be the guy who\nhas a problem with his boss slapping his bottom.'
I gotta tell ya, I think it\xc2\x92s okay to be that guy.'
Yeah, maybe it\xc2\x92s like y'know, that jock thing. Y'know how football\nplayers pat each other after touchdowns. (pats Ross on the butt) "
Y'know I don\xc2\x92t, I don\xc2\x92t understand guys, I mean I-I would\nnever congratulate Monica on a great stew by y'know, grabbin\xc2\x92 her boob."
Yeah, I know, for a really great stew you just y'know, stick your head\nin between \xc2\x91em."
Okay, can we please go eat?'
Yeah. What are we getting?'
(to Chandler) Anything but stew.'
All right so, Chandler, from now on, don\xc2\x92t give your boss a chance to\nget you. Y'know just ah, don\xc2\x92t turn your back to him."

Yeah, or you can teach him a lesson. Y'know? What you could do is you
could rub something that really smells on your butt, all right? Then, when he goes to
smack ya, his hand will smell. (thinking aloud) Now what could you rub on your butt that
would smell bad?"
(to Ross and Monica) What if Joey were president?'
Umm, hey Rach, can I ask you something?'
Yeah.'
Okay, you can totally say no, but umm, would it be okay with you if I\nset Ross up on a date?'
Oh, ah with who?'
Umm, my friend, Bonnie. She just always thought Ross was really cute,\nand now that you two aren\xc2\x92t together, she asked if I could set it up, but if\nyou\xc2\x92re not cool with it...'
Oh-oh-oh, which one is Bonnie again?'
You remember her from my birthday party two years ago. She\xc2\x92s yeah,\nlike, average height, medium build, bald...'
Oh! (laughs) That\xc2\x92s fine.'
Great! Okay, good for you! (as they leave she slaps Rachel on the butt)'
You are iron. You are steel! Let me ask you something, how come when I\ncall your computer support line, I have to wait an hour and a half?'
I told you, we\xc2\x92re adding new operators all the time. Could we\nconcentrate on my training?'
It\xc2\x92s just hard when I know I have e-mail I can\xc2\x92t get! '
(entering) Hi!'
Monica! (runs over and kisses her) Hi honey.'
All right, on the table. (Pete gets on the table for his rubdown)'

Hey, umm, so listen umm, my friends were telling me a little about this\nah, ultimate fighting thing and it, well it sounds really dangerous. I-I don\xc2\x92t want\nyou to get hurt, \xc2\x91cause I kinda like you.'

Oh, believe me, I don\xc2\x92t want to get hurt either. I\xc2\x92m being smart
about this. See these guys? They\xc2\x92re the best trainers in the world, and Hoshi here
used to be a paid assassin. (Hoshi yells at him in Chinese) A house painter! He used to be
a house painter.'
Promise me you\xc2\x92ll be careful.'
I promise.'
Hey, are we still on for tonight?'
Yeah.'
Okay, good, \xc2\x91cause umm, well maybe we could have a little workout\nof our own...'
No! No boom-boom before big fight!'
How \xc2\x91bout just a boom?'
(to Phoebe) Well that was depressing, I think I just bought a soft\npretzel from one of the kids from Fame. Ready to go to the movies?'
Um-hmm. Oh wait! This is Bonnie. (who has hair by the way)'
Hi!'
This is Bonnie? (to Phoebe) This is Bonnie? (to Bonnie) You\xc2\x92re\nBonnie?'
I can show you an ID if you want?'
Oh no, I\xc2\x92m sorry, you look a lot different from the last time I-I\nsaw you.'
Oh yeah, well I just started wearing bras again.'
Oh, that must be it.'
(to Bonnie) Well I hope you have fun tonight.'
Thanks! You too.'
(to Phoebe) You said she was bald.'
Yeah, she was bald, she\xc2\x92s not now.'
How could you not tell me that she has hair?'
I don\xc2\x92t know, I hardly ever say that about people.'
(looks in the window) Ohh, well, this is just perfect!'
Well I\xc2\x92m sorry, I thought you said it was okay.'
Yeah, I said what was okay when I thought she was some weird bald chick.\nI mean, y'know, that girl has hair got all over head!"
Well, maybe it won\xc2\x92t work out. Maybe Ross won\xc2\x92t like her\npersonality.'
Why, does she have a bad personality?'
Oh no, Bonnie\xc2\x92s the best!'

Bing! (Chandler stands bolt upright and turns around to face him.) Read
your Computech proposal, a real homerun. (He goes to slap his butt, but Chandler slides
over making him miss.) Ooh. Barely got ya that time, get over here. Come on. (Chandler
goes over) Wham! (slaps him on the butt) Good one. That was a good one. (to a couple of
Chandler\xc2\x92s co-workers) Keep at it team. (goes into his office)'
(to his co-workers) What is with him?'
With him? You\xc2\x92re is favourite, you\xc2\x92re his guy!'
We never get smacked.'
Well, that\xc2\x92s not true, he-he smacked you once.'
Not on purpose, he ricocheted of you and got me.'
I\xc2\x92m telling you, I need some smacks. I got a kid starting\nDartmouth in the fall.'
(coming out of his office) Dartmouth? Who went to Dartmouth? Dartmouth\nsucks. Did you go to Dartmouth Bing?'
No sir.'
There you go. (smacks him on the butt)'
(walking up with this huge tub-o-popcorn and drink) Hey!'
God Ross, what is that?'
Yeah, it\xc2\x92s the Ultimate Fighting Combo. Yeah, I saved thirty cents,\nplus I get to keep the cup. Yay!!'
From New York City, New York! Appearing in his Ultimate Fighting\nChampionship debut! He\xc2\x92s known for his confrontational business style. Ladies and\nGentlemen, introducing Pete Beck-errrr!!'
I love you, Pete!!!'
And his opponent, from Hunnington Beach, California! He\xc2\x92s a 300\npound street fighter, Tank Abbottttttt!!!! '
(going up to the ring) Pete! Pete!! That guy\xc2\x92s pretty huge!'
Don\xc2\x92t worry, Hoshi taught me how to use an opponent\xc2\x92s strength\nand weight against him.'
Well, then that guy is in serious, serious trouble.'
All right! You go get him! Let\xc2\x92s go!'
Here we go gentlemen, here we go! (to Tank Abbott) Are you ready? (He\nnods, and takes out his teeth) (to Pete) Are you ready? (Pete nods, \xc2\x93Yes.\xc2\x94)\nLet\xc2\x92s get it on!!'
Uh-oh.'
Hey! (she sits down next to him) It\xc2\x92s me. Mon-i-ca! Can I just tell\nyou how proud I am of you.'
It would be nice after hearing 20,000 people chant \xc2\x93You suck!\xc2\x94'
I mean I-I thought you were nuts at first, but you-you did it. And now\nyou can just look back at this thing with no regrets.'
What, look back?'
Well, you\xc2\x92re not gonna get going are you?'
Well let me ask you a question. Am I the Ultimate Fighting Champion?'
Well, no. But...'
Well I\xc2\x92m not gonna stop until I\xc2\x92m the Ultimate Fighting\nChampion.'
That guy stood on your neck until you passed out!'

Let me tell you a story. When I set out to create Moss 865, do you think
it just happened overnight? No. There was Moss 1, that burnt down my Dad\xc2\x92s garage,
there was Moss 2 that would only schedule appointments in January, and 862 others that I
learned from, just like I learned from this fight, never to let a guy stand on my neck.'
You didn\xc2\x92t know that already?'
Look, I\xc2\x92m gonna get better. Okay? I promise you.'
Okay, just get a lot better. (pause) Fast.'
Oh, one other thing. Hoshi thinks that you being ringside may have\naffected my concentration.'
Yeah. That-that was the problem.'
(joining them) Hey.'
Hey! How long until Pete\xc2\x92s fight?'
Oh, about five minutes. Right now they\xc2\x92re interviewing his\nopponent. Apparently he trains by going to Iran and pulling the arms off thieves.'
Hot dog?'
Four, please. (Ross looks at her) I\xc2\x92m really nervous. (Ross gives\nher the four dogs) Thank you. (she grabs four buns, and heads back inside)'
So Ross, how umm, how did it go with Bonnie?'
What? Oh! I gotta tell you, I-I wasn\xc2\x92t expecting to like her at all,\nI mean I actually wasn\xc2\x92t expecting to like anyone right now, but she\xc2\x92s really\nterrific.'
Ohh, that\xc2\x92s too bad!'
No, I-I\xc2\x92m saying I liked her.'
Yeah, y'know what, there are other fish in the sea."
Pheebs, I think she\xc2\x92s great. Okay? We\xc2\x92re going out again.'
Okay, I hear you! Are you capable of talking about any thing else?'
(joining them) Hey! Which one\xc2\x92s my turkey burger?'
Ahh, the one next to my foot. Sorry.'
(sticking his head out the window) Hey, the fight\xc2\x92s starting!'
Okay, we\xc2\x92ll be right in. (to Chandler) So ah, did your boss try to\nslap you again today?'
Nine times! Okay, I had to put on lotion! But, it\xc2\x92s gonna be\nokay, because as of tomorrow I\xc2\x92m conducting an experiment, and if all goes as\nplanned, my butt will be smack free.'
(sticking his head out the window) Fight\xc2\x92s over!'
Excuse me, Doug? (no reaction) Hey there sports fan!!'
(turning around) Bing! You got those numbers for me?'
No, I ah, I didn\xc2\x92t do them.'
Oh, you forgot?'
No, no I just ah, didn\xc2\x92t do them. Instead, I ah, hung out with a\ncouple of friends and had a couple of beers so I certainly don\xc2\x92t deserve any praise,\nverbal or otherwise.'

Well, I got tanked myself last night. Pretty dicey drive home, Tapanzi\nBridge never looked smaller. (laughs) That\xc2\x92s okay, you\xc2\x92re still my number one\nguy! (slaps him on the butt) Bing!'
Doug!!'
Hmm.'
I\xc2\x92m a little bit uncomfortable with the that way you express\nyourself.'
Oh, is it the swearing? I mean is it the constant swearing? Because I\ngotta tell ya, if it is, you can just... kiss my ass!'
No, no. It-it\xc2\x92s not about the swearing, it\xc2\x92s more about ah,\nthe way, that you ah, occasionally, concentrate, your enthusiasm on my buttock.'
Oh?'
Oh, and don\xc2\x92t get me wrong, I appreciate the sentiment. It\xc2\x92s\njust that I, I have a rather, sensitive posterior, and ah, besides, it\xc2\x92s making all\nthe other guys jealous.'
Well, say no more. Y'know it takes guts to bring this up. Bing!\nYou\xc2\x92re okay."
Okay. (he starts to leave)'
Ha! (goes to smack him on the butt, but stops, faking Chandler out)\nAhhhhhhh!'
Ahhhhh! (walks out, imitating shooting himself in the head)'
Okay. Would you rather live in the shirt pocket of a sweaty giant, or\ninside his shower drain?'
(seeing Ross and Bonnie inside Central Perk) Oh my God! Phoebe look,\nit\xc2\x92s Ross and that girl.'
No! No! Look at that! (drags her away from the window) It\xc2\x92s a line\nof ants! They\xc2\x92re working as a team!'
Phoebe! (goes back to the window)'
(looking in the window) Right, oh yeah. Wow, oh, it looks like Ross is\nbreaking up with her. Uff, I hope he lets her down easy. Let\xc2\x92s go.'

Come on Phoebe, look at that! They are not breaking up, look at them.\nOkay that\xc2\x92s, you know what that is? That is a, that is a second date, that\xc2\x92s\nwhat that is! Look at that, she just put her hand on his thigh...'
Oh no! That really is nothing, she is very sexually aggressive.'
Ohh! (walking away from the window) Phoebe, this is all your fault! Now\nhe loves her, he\xc2\x92s gonna marry her, and this is all your fault.'
You said it was okay!'
You said she was bald!!'
What?! What-what-what-what-what?!!'

Phoebe, we can\xc2\x92t, we just can\xc2\x92t just let it happen! Okay, we\nhave to do something! We have to break them up! Okay? Just go in there and like, shave her\nhead! You owe me one bald girl!!'
Okay, first of all, breathe. Second of all, I don\xc2\x92t get it.\nAren\xc2\x92t you the one that decided that you didn\xc2\x92t want to be with Ross?'
(quietly) Yes.'
Well isn\xc2\x92t he your friend? Don\xc2\x92t you want him to be happy?'
Yes.'
So?'
I just y'know, I didn\xc2\x92t expect him to be this happy so soon. Ufff.\nOoo-ooh! (sits down on the curb) "
(sits down next to her and hugs her) Oh no.'
What?'
Oh, we killed them all.'
Oh! '
It\xc2\x92s okay, it\xc2\x92s not as bad as it looks, it\xc2\x92s a precaution.\nAh, I\xc2\x92m not supposed to move my spine.'
Please tell me you\xc2\x92re stopping now.'
I\xc2\x92m fine! I\xc2\x92d fight tonight, if they\xc2\x92d let me. (stands up\nand starts swinging his arms) See this circle I\xc2\x92m marking off here? This is my zone\nof terror.'
You are insane! You-you gotta give this up!'

I can\xc2\x92t until I\xc2\x92m the ultimate fighter. I will do it. I\xc2\x92m\ntelling you, the day will come when children will argue over who will win a fight, me or\nSuperman. Now, I\xc2\x92m not saying I could beat Superman, but y'know, kids are stupid."
Sit down. All right? Please, just listen to me. You are terrible at\nthis! Okay? You are the worst ultimate fighter ever! Ever!! '
Y'know I have a torn rotator cuff, a hairline fracture in my right\nforearm, and a severely bruised Adam\xc2\x92s Apple, but that really hurt."
Well then, y'know what? I care about you to much to watch you hurt\nyourself like this. So if you have to do this, then you\xc2\x92re gonna have to do it\nwithout me."
Well if you\xc2\x92re asking me to quit, then you\xc2\x92re asking me to be\nsomeone I\xc2\x92m not. I\xc2\x92ve got to do this.'
Then I\xc2\x92ve gotta go. Bye. (kisses him and starts to walk out)'
Mon-Monica?'
Yes?'
Could you leave a note? \xc2\x91Cause I\xc2\x92m on a lot of pain killers now,\nand I don\xc2\x92t know if I\xc2\x92ll remember this tomorrow. (She leaves.)'
So, in conclusion, the lines all go up (points to the chart), so I\xc2\x92m\nhappy. Great job team! Tomorrow at 8
Thank you, sir.'
(coming back in) Oh, excuse me. I forgot my briefcase y'know, by\naccident."
Of course, you did. Forgot something else too ya bastard! (smacks him on\nthe butt) (to Chandler) Well, what about you? You\xc2\x92re not feeling left out or anything\nare ya?'
No. No, not at all, that\xc2\x92s-that\xc2\x92s ridiculous.'
Everybody else got one, and you want one too. Don\xc2\x92t you?'
Ye-ye-yeah, yes I do!'
Now get on out of here, you! (smacks him on the butt)'
Pete Becker is circling the ring now. It looks like, he\xc2\x92s\njust trying to feel him out. Oh, Bruiser is just...'
Run! Run you crazy, rich freak!'
Oh, I can\xc2\x92t watch this. (turns her eyes away)'
Check it out, he\xc2\x92s winning! (to Monica) Pete\xc2\x92s winning!'
Really?!'
No-o-o!!'
Uh-oh, Bruiser has Becker on the canvas and is going for his\nfavourite area.'
Oh! Oh! (they all recoil in horror)'
Wait, if that\xc2\x92s his favourite area, why is he being so mean to it?'
Well, this is ironic. Of your last two boyfriends, Richard didn\xc2\x92t\nwant to have kids, and from the looks of it, now Pete can\xc2\x92t.'
Ohh!! (they all start pointing at the screen)'
